sentence.Network_en: John Maynard Keynes used somewhat gnomic utterances in his General Theory.
sentence.Network_cn: 约翰·梅纳德·凯恩斯在其《通论》中用了许多精辟言辞。

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 19th cent.: from Greek gnōmikos (perhaps via French gnomique), from gnōmē 'thought, judgement', (plural) gnōmai 'sayings, maxims', related to gignōskein 'know'

entry.def: A gnomic remark is brief and seems wise but is difficult to understand.

example.ex: ...the somewhat gnomic utterances of John Maynard Keynes in his General Theory.
example.tran: 约翰·梅纳德·凯恩斯在其《通论》中的精辟言辞
